full_summary:
**Grant Passage CCG SAR Geotechnical and Servicing Study**
=============================================

**Request for Proposal**
-------------------

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites you to submit a proposal for the Grand Passage CCG SAR Geotechnical and Servicing Study, located on Long Island, Digby County, Nova Scotia, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) and Canadian Coast Guard (CCG).

**Background**
------------

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) and Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) require heavy civil engineering services to support the planning and design of a new Canadian Coast Guard Search and Rescue Station (CCG-SAR) in Grand Passage, Long Island, Digby County, Nova Scotia. This request for proposal is based on a Supply Arrangement (SA) EB129-192368 Heavy Civil Engineering Services (Geotechnical).

**Scope of Work**
-----------------

The successful responder will be responsible for completing a geotechnical investigation and site servicing study to support the planning and design of the new CCG-SAR station. The scope of work includes:

* Geotechnical investigation
* Site servicing study

**Eligible Suppliers**
-------------------

This tender is open to the following eligible suppliers registered on the WB Rated VSS list:

* Harbourside Geotechnical
* Stantec Consulting
* BGC Engineering Inc
* Englobe Corp

**Important Dates**
----------------

* Tender closing date: December 8, 2023, at 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)
* Expected contract start date: December 30, 2023
* Expected contract end date: March 31, 2026

**Contract Information**
----------------------

The contract will be awarded on the basis of a highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For any questions or concerns, please contact Grant, Stewart (SPAC/PSPC) at stewart.grant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

Note: This notice was previously published on the PSPC Contracting Activities website. Please refer to the original notice for any additional information. The request for proposal package is only available electronically through the PSPC Contracting Activities website. All proposals must be submitted electronically. A proposal information session will be held on December 5, 2023, at 2:00 PM (Eastern Time). For more information, please contact the Contracting Authority.
